definitions.text: a high bid that is intended to prevent the opposing players from bidding
acquire for oneself before others can do so
take the place of or have precedence over
examples: live broadcast of the presidential debate preempts the regular news hour
discussion of the emergency situation will preempt the lecture by the professor

definitions.text: gain possession of by prior right or opportunity, especially so as to obtain the right to buy (land)
make a preemptive bid in the game of bridge
